headline: Marshall Browning Hospital Selects Oracle Health CommunityWorks to Optimize Care Delivery, Expand Access to Healthcare in Its Rural Community
summary: Marshall Browning Hospital (MBH) will replace its legacy electronic health record (EHR) with Oracle Health CommunityWorks solutions, to optimize financial outcomes and help elevate patient care in its surrounding communities. MBH will also adopt Oracle Health Clinical AI Agent, the AI-powered, voice-driven solution that helps streamline workflows and clinical documentation and helps physicians focus more on patient care.

headline: Oracle Stock Set to Drop for Fourth Day. How Its OpenAI Bet Went Wrong for the Shares.
summary: Oracle  stock has given back all the gains from the cloud computing group’s “  Nvidia  Moment” as investors grow increasingly cautious over investments linked to the artificial intelligence boom.  The selloff is due, in part, to the stock having risen so sharply over the month that followed its update, as news investors both took profits on the meteoric gains and began the early rotation into non-tech names that has helped the  outpace both the  and the  over the past four weeks.

headline: Does Meta, Google's use of debt to finance AI signal a bubble?
summary: Meta (META), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), and Oracle (ORCL) are among the companies funding artificial intelligence (AI) spending through corporate bond sales. Robinhood chief investment officer Stephanie Guild, Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Ines Ferré, and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma examine whether the trend signals the existence of an AI bubble. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Oracle bonds sell off as AI investment fuels investor concerns
summary: (Reuters) -Oracle Corp bonds have taken a hit in recent days following a report that the cloud and artificial ​intelligence service provider plans to add another $38 billion to its heavy ‌debt load to fund its AI infrastructure, according to analysts and investors.  "So what's interesting is most of the (major tech) companies ‍are trying to sustain their (stock) buyback programs at the same time that they're spending on capex currently and to do that, they're actually borrowing and so they'​re using debt," said Lisa Shalett, chief investment officer of ‌Morgan Stanley Wealth Management.  Renewed questions around the safety of this bet appeared to have surfaced in trading of Oracle's bonds this week, following reporting by CNBC on Thursday that Oracle plans to assume an additional $38 billion in debt.

content.title: Oracle bonds sell off as AI investment fuels investor concerns
content.summary: (Reuters) -Oracle Corp bonds have taken a hit in recent days following a report that the cloud and artificial ​intelligence service provider plans to add another $38 billion to its heavy ‌debt load to fund its AI infrastructure, according to analysts and investors.  "So what's interesting is most of the (major tech) companies ‍are trying to sustain their (stock) buyback programs at the same time that they're spending on capex currently and to do that, they're actually borrowing and so they'​re using debt," said Lisa Shalett, chief investment officer of ‌Morgan Stanley Wealth Management.  Renewed questions around the safety of this bet appeared to have surfaced in trading of Oracle's bonds this week, following reporting by CNBC on Thursday that Oracle plans to assume an additional $38 billion in debt.
